original_title: China Merchants Group Chairman visits Sri Lanka’ Hambantota Port
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Chairman of China Merchants Group, Miao Jianmin has visited Sri Lanka’s Hambantota Port, which is managed by the group, a statement said.
The group which also has built operate transfer container terminal in Colombo Port, would continue to make investments in the South Asian region, he was quoted as saying at the port.

China Merchants Ports Holdings Company Limited (CMPort), which is partner in a join venture which rusn the port network spanning South Asia, Africa, the Mediterranean and South America with a network of 42 ports spanning 25 countries, the statement said.

“The Group plans to actively promote cooperation with international high-quality enterprises such as Sinopec and focus on RORO, bulk cargo, oil and gas, development of container handling, industrial park, and maritime services,” the statement said.
“It is the Group’s mission to build a world-class comprehensive port, with continuously improving supply chain services.”

CMG’s origin dates back to 1872 when it was founded as China’s first commercial corporation, the statement said. Today, the China Merchants Group has over 280,000 employees worldwide.  (Colombo/Apr25/2023)
